product: LED 9W PK 12
title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Value for money
body:
Bought 2 bulbs for 119/- in August 2023. So at 60 a piece, this is great value for money. Cause you get bulbs at such a price only when you buy in bulk, like 10 bulbs.I had to return the first set I received as one of the bulbs was only bright like a 5 or 4 watt LED bulb. The replacement request was processed and I got the replacement pair which was\is working well.Longevity has now become a concern for LED bulbs as they are trying to make it as cheap\affordable as possible. So we are going to end up replacing these bulbs every 2 to 3 years. So the cheaper you buy if for, the better. I still have some of the havells, philips LED bulbs that I bought for like 500, 600 bucks still working fine, though their efficiency is only around 50 Lumen\Watt. Once the price came down to like 200 per bulb (10 Watt Bulb), the quality has gone down noticeably. Prices have come down even further now, so the quality will have only dropped further.
Read more

product: Pure Source India Electric Aroma Diffuser for Home (10 ml Rose & Lavender Fragrance)
title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Better Alternative to Artificial Room Freshener
body:
Have been using a non-electric one for a while so switched to this electric one.- Price is alright or pretty decent if you want to gift the combo to someone.- The size of the Diffuser is as shown in the description.- The light is pretty bright so I kept it in the lower corner shelf in my hall which I kind of a dark area. Also, to avoid my dog going and touching it, as obviously, the entire diffuser gets heated up when in use.- The water quantity is pretty decent for me. It's enough for my living area+kitchen space to fill up with the fragrance for a few hours.- I already have my collection of the Essential Oils so haven't used the ones which they sent yet. But the combination of water and oil needs to be perfect as per your needs. And also not every Essential Oil suits everyone.- If using regularly, make sure to wipe it off gently every day.
Read more

I tried contacting support and they are still processing my concern [I'll update you about it later].  I pull the bulb out of the ceramic container and both the bulb and its holder are defective. Since its a non-returnable product so I think now I need to buy the bulb and its holder from the market to make it work again. A legendary English tea brew with its own aroma and taste unlike any other. If 25 strips are put in a transparent pouch in each partition, they will not jumble till opened. Also packets when picked are too slippery in fingers and surface needs to be coarse. The brew done for 3-4 min is pretty good.

product: PHILIPS 14W E27 LED Warm White Bulb, Pack of 1
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Bright and Reliable LED Bulb with Room for Improvement
body:
This LED bulb offers a perfect color that is nice and bright, making it a great choice for illuminating any room. One of the most impressive aspects is its longevity - I've been using the same bulb for over a year without any issues or failures. The quality and durability of this product are top-notch.However, it's worth noting that the brightness level is comparable to a Philips 9W warm-white bulb. While this may be sufficient for some users, others might find it lacking and not worth the investment. It would be great to see an increase in brightness to set this bulb apart from its competitors.Overall, this LED bulb delivers on its promise of being a reliable and long-lasting lighting solution. The color and quality are commendable, but there is room for improvement in terms of brightness. If you're looking for a dependable bulb and don't mind the brightness level, this product is definitely worth considering.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
The best seller on Amazon, with the best product for water treatment!
body:
I usually do not write reviews. But, I wanted to take time to write about the product and the seller. 101 Innovations is the best seller I came across Amazon. I ordered this product and it came in specified time, thanks to Amazon. But unfortunately, it doesn't fit to my tap. It needed an extra adaptor, which I didn't know how to get. I contacted the seller, and guess what? They sent the adaptor immediately through Delhivery and that too free of cost. Never expected such a positive response from a seller.Now, coming to the product:Pros:1. I could literally feel the difference after connecting it to the tap. The hardness has decreased noticeably.2. This product is a boon to the hair. Now, my hair feels very soft.3. Skin has become very soft and the moisture is retained.4. It is very easy to install. Doesn't require a plumber or any technician.Cons:None as of now.

product: Wonderchef Granite Non-Stick Dosa Tawa, Induction Bottom, Soft-Touch Handles, Virgin Grade Aluminium, PFOA/Heavy Metals Fr...
title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Awesome non stick product, not sure about handle.
body:
So I am writing this review after a month of using this tawa. I brought it for INR 1300 or so, after a million research. I was confused between prestige and wonderchef.Pro:This is super non stick, easy to clean and the food glides on the pan. I tried making dosa, chilla , omlette and even pancakes. Nothing stuck. So it's completely non stick.Cons:As you can see in the picture after a moth of use the handle has started cracking. So I have started using it on low flame and keeping the handle a little away from the flame, but this should not happen if the company says the quality is so good. Also on high heat you can start smelling the teflon coating.I would try buying a prestige next and see if that is better than wonderchef. For now, but it if you really just need a non stick tawa that doesn't stick to anything even without oil.
Read more

product: DYNAMIC COOKWARES Cast Iron Dosa Tawa 11 Inch, 28CM (Black)
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
10 steps to get paper-crisp dosas from this tawa
body:
The media could not be loaded.
                



¬†This is a good dosa tawa, sturdy, strong, and with a high finish quality. Before purchasing I went through the reviews of this product and wasn't sure if I'd get good dosas but i took the plunge and here are my learnings (after a lot of research!)Heres how you make good dosas in 10 steps using a cast iron (watch the attached video):1. Ensure the tawa is seasoned well as per manufacturer's detailed instructions.2. Ensure you are patient (This is the most critical!)3. Ensure to preheat the tawa on low-medium heat. DO NOT speed up the process by pre-heating on high flame. Slow heating helps the tawa retain an even heat that is essential for good bronzing of the dosa.4. Ensure the dosa batter is at or near room temperature.5. Check the tawa is properly preheating by lightly spraying water. It must not evaporate immediately but sizzle a bit. If too hot, spray some water to cool down.5. Pour the batter onto lightly oiled tawa (you can completely cut out the oil if you so desire, once the tawa is seasoned really well after many times of use)5. Now wait. Sing a song if you like, because of the low-medium heating this is going to take time. Kitchens are good places to practice singing (because of all the tiling, they're almost as good as bathroom for this purpose!)6. Once you see the underside of the doas browing, slowly test only the edges of the dosa, to see if it is ready to flip. (As the dosa batter heats up, the pores on the iron slowly start expanding and closing up because of the heat and when properly closed will be ready to release the dosa like a non-stick.7. The above point is THE MOST IMPORTANT and where i think most people fail. Apply too much force to try and release the dosa and inevitably the dosa will get stuck and you will need to scrape it off.8. When the edges release with minimal force, try and slowly lift the rest of the dosa. If you encounter too much resistance, give it more time (Remember point 2!)9. When properly done, flip the dosa (if you so desire) or take off from pan10. Enjoy!Note: Use as much or as little oil as you like. Using a spatula (like in the video) helps to reduce the amount of oil you would normally pour onto the dosa. However, more than oiling, understainding how the pores work is essential to enjoy the non-stick properties of the tawa and to ensure paper-crisp dosas!
Read more

product: DYNAMIC COOKWARES Cast Iron Dosa Tawa 11 Inch, 28CM (Black)
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Read this if your dosas are getting stuck on the pan
body:
To all users whose dosas are getting stuck on the pan...pls read my review below...Iam sure it will be helpful.After we bought this dynamic cast iron pan, I seasoned it using method A given in the instruction booklet...namely by coating with oil all over the pan...and frying some cut up onions and then turning off the heat...and leaving the onions to cool on the pan. Not sure if I did anything wrong...but this process this not work at all. Made 4 dosas and all the dosas got stuck to the pan horribly. Had to scrape it all off one by one. Got terribly dissapointed. :((Next day...fresh start. First thing..I oiled the pan nicely...spread salt all over the pan and using a soft scrubber..scrubbed the pan clean of all residue. Washed it with plain water and wiped it dry. Next coated it with a light layer of oil (I used cold pressed coconut oil...u can use any oil. NOTE: do not apply a thick layer of oil...just a thin layer), and kept it on the stove flame in minimum heat n heated it slowly till smoke started coming from the pan. Let the oil smoke for a bit. At this point..I turned off the gas and allowed the pan to cool slowly and naturally by itself. Patience is the key! This smoking oil step completes the polymerization of the cast iron pan...and essentially turns it into a non stick pan. You can test if the polymerization step is completed successfully by two things. Firstly touch the surface of the pan after it cools down..it should not be sticky. Secondly the surface should look dark and shiny. This means that the cast iron pan is now polymerized and will now behave like a non stick pan.Finally after the pan cooled...I oiled the top surface of the pan...heated it up (kept flame in low medium). Sprinkle some water on the hot pan ..the water should sizzle...take a cloth or tissue to evenly spread the oil..and start making dosas. Thin, crispy perfectly made dosas came every time. :)) Finally!THREE IMPORTANT POINTS1. During the polymerization process, once the oil starts smoking on the pan..turn off the heat and let the pan cool slowly. Do not try to speed up the process. Let it cool naturally.2. Always keep the pan on low medium heat and never on high heat.2. Sprinkle water on heated pan from time to time so that the pan doesn't get overheated and spread the oil evenly using a cloth or tissue...before making the dosas.Hope this review is helpful to all those who are struggling with their dosas getting stuck on the pan! :))

Not really Stainless Steel
body:

I don't really know; but it's certainly rusted where the water droplets get left on the shower head after you've finished showering - I've attached a picture.Other than that, it works well, looks nice, and is much cheaper than many options. But if you want a rust-free stainless steel shower head, you ought to look elsewhere.

body:
I purchased this AC unit with high hopes, but unfortunately, it failed to meet even the most basic expectations. Within just one month of purchase, the unit stopped cooling altogether. Frustrated, I promptly created a ticket for assistance, expecting a prompt resolution. However, to my dismay, not a single technician attended to the issue within the following week. Despite making multiple calls and attempting to escalate the matter through the website, I encountered nothing but roadblocks. The supposed channels for support proved to be ineffective, leaving me stranded with a malfunctioning AC unit and no viable solution in sight. This experience has been extremely disappointing, and I cannot recommend this product or the associated customer service to others.

product: Ohuhu 100 Colors Art Markers Set, Dual Tips Coloring Brush Fineliner Color Marker Pens, Water Based Marker for Calligraphy...
title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Very good for the price
body:
Update with attached art I do with it now after 9 months of usage: pretty darn useful pens, the only problem I'd talk of now is the fraying of nibs, just be careful with thoseI've been doing lettering and journaling for two years now, and I think many would find this detailed review helpful.1. Build quality (3/5): the cardboard box that the brush pens came in are sturdy enough, and very pretty. Though you'd probably want to transfer the pens somewhere else because this box probably won't last.The pens themselves are of average build quality. There's a matte finish to the thing which looks pretty, but they are light and flimsy. That's to be expected given the price.The nib was quite disappointing for me. It's a hard nib and not flexible at all. If you exert too much pressure, you'll just wear it out faster. Extremely prone to fraying. What this means is if your main thing is calligraphy, this is not the pen for you. But if you are buying this for drawing purposes, it's pretty good. Also, hard tips are always better for newbies as it gives them more stability. Just go easy on the pressure.2. Ink (4.5/5): The ink quality is really good, imo. The colours are vibrant, the pastels are true pastels, the ink dries quickly. And despite what I read in other reviews, it's actually pretty easy to blend. (Remember, these are water based and will NEVER be as good at blending as alcohol based markers). If you want the blend to be more seamless, try transferring the ink to a palette and using a paintbrush. Would definitely help. There is also no bleeding, and barely there ghosting on paper as thin as 90 gsm. For bujo purposes, it's truly great. There also seems to be plenty of ink in the pens, I have not experienced any blotchy strokes so far. The colours are really good, and at least irl, you can tell all of them apart. The cap on a few pens are a little off from the ink, but it's a non-issue for me.3. Overall: I got these for a mere 1k, so I'd definitely say it's value-for-money. Whether you want to upgrade from Camlin's limited 24 shades or have a cheaper replacement of Tombow Dual pens, this is a very good option. Don't expect expert calligraphy/lettering skills from these. But for beginners, or even broke intermediate artists like me, this is a good buy.
Read more

body:
Review:I recently purchased the Tiffin Box Bag, and I must say, it has exceeded my expectations in every way. This bag has proven to be the ideal solution for carrying my tiffin boxes securely and conveniently.First and foremost, the design of the bag is exceptional. The material used is of high quality, providing durability and ensuring that it will last for a long time. The stitching is sturdy and well-done, giving me confidence that it can withstand regular use without any issues.One of the standout features of this bag is its perfect fit for all my tiffin boxes. Regardless of the size or shape of my tiffin boxes, they fit snugly inside the bag. The compartments are spacious and well-padded, allowing for easy and organized placement of multiple tiffin boxes without the risk of any spillage or damage.The bag's handles are comfortable to hold, and the adjustable shoulder strap adds versatility to the carrying options. I appreciate the attention to detail in the design, such as the strong zippers that ensure the contents remain secure throughout transportation.Furthermore, the insulation provided by the bag is impressive. It effectively keeps the food at the desired temperature, whether it's hot or cold. This feature is particularly useful when I need to carry my tiffin boxes for an extended period, knowing that my food will remain fresh and appetizing.Another aspect I love about this bag is its easy maintenance. The interior lining is water-resistant, making it effortless to clean any spills or stains. Simply wiping it with a damp cloth is usually sufficient to keep it looking neat and presentable.In conclusion, the Tiffin Box Bag has been a game-changer for me. Its excellent design, perfect fit for all my tiffin boxes, and reliable insulation make it a must-have for anyone who carries their meals on the go. I highly recommend this bag to fellow tiffin box users who value convenience, durability, and functionality.
